review_blob:
Lots of hops, but to little effect. Simcoe is almost certainly used, and seems the most apparent. But they are just flushed together into not very much. Disappointing.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Creamy in the mouth, opening up to a crisp dry finish, acidic hoppyness, fruity. Big bitterness, but we'll balanced with the strength and crispness. Great body, good appearance. Malt not got much play other than body. But, the beautifully dry finish really does put this up there.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Good hoppyness, but almost so bitter it burns. Not quite sure what the rye brings to the table, except extra bitterness and it rhymes with 'I'. Needs better balance. But, saying that the body is good, and it has a lovely nuttiness.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Bursting fruity hops, very American in style. Bitterness can be a little harsh, but over all a delight. Has notes of peaches.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Almost underwhelming initially, but quickly ascend in the palate to a crisp and juicy hop finish. What I assume are Munich malts add some sweetness, balancing out the hoppyness. Less grassy notes than most IPAs, traditional UK style. Used to taste more powerful and citrusy, not sure what they changed.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

No real aroma, taste notes are light and fresh, smooth and fruity, do not drink cold.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Smokey notes, the strength makes it smooth, opens the pallete nicely. Aroma is very smokey too, almost like smoked bacon.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
